ORCID: 1032-1623-8108-1603. He posts frequently about new discoveries.
generated_scam_email:
Subject: Urgent Review Request – Manuscript Aligned with Your Recent IEEE Work on Digital Humanities

Dear Dr. Carter,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing on behalf of the editorial board of *Interdisciplinary Studies in Quantum Culture* (ISQC), a new diamond-open-access journal supported by the Horizon Europe research infrastructure grant. Given your groundbreaking contribution in “Digital Humanities in Literature: A Novel Approach” (IEEE TQE, 2024) and your leadership of the €2 M post-colonial literature project at BioGenesis University, we would be honored if you could serve as a peer reviewer for a manuscript that cites your work extensively and extends its quantitative methods to marine-narrative datasets.

The submission, titled “Algorithmic Decolonization of Oceanic Narratives: A Quantum-Textual Framework,” directly engages with Section IV.B of your IEEE paper, proposing an entanglement-based metric for post-colonial sentiment that the authors adapted from your code repository. A concise 3,200-word version is attached as manuscript_updates.docx; the full 9,800-word paper is available through our secure portal.

Because the authors have indicated that they will present preliminary results at next month’s Journal of Marine Ecosystems conference—the same venue where you are scheduled to speak—we are aiming to complete the review cycle within 14 days. Your expert insight would be invaluable in ensuring methodological rigor and proper contextualization of post-colonial theory.

Could you kindly confirm your availability by 5 June?  
To accept, please click the personalized link below and log in with your ORCID (1032-1623-8108-1603). The portal will automatically populate the manuscript and our review form.

https://isqc-horizon.eu/review-portal/invitation/accept/8f3d4a1c

Thank you in advance for considering this request. We deeply appreciate your commitment to advancing interdisciplinary scholarship.

Warm regards,

Dr. Marina Delgado  
Associate Editor, *Interdisciplinary Studies in Quantum Culture*  
European Centre for Quantum Humanities  
marina.delgado@isqc-horizon.eu
strategy_desc: Pretend to be a journal editor or a peer-review system sending an invitation to review a manuscript. Lead the target to a spoofed review portal designed to phish login credentials.

Dear Dr. Davies,

The Brain Health Foundation’s Grant Administration Office is pleased to confirm that your project “Sustainable Chemical Synthesis: A Novel Approach” (Award No. BHF-5M-SCS-2024-0193) has cleared its final scientific review and is now ready for disbursement. Please access the submission portal here:  
https://submissions.brainhealth-foundation.org/secure/grant-finalization  

A modest processing fee of $295 is required by Foundation policy to offset administrative costs. Payment instructions are embedded in the form and can be completed safely through the same portal.

Should you require expedited assistance, reply directly to this message with the phrase “Priority – Davies SCS 2024” in the subject line and our compliance officer will contact you within two hours.

Sincerely,

Dr. Elena Moreau

On behalf of the Climate Research Fund Awards Committee, I am delighted to inform you that your recent proposal “Digital Archiving: A Novel Approach” has been selected as the recipient of the 2024 Distinguished Fellowship Award (DFA-24-CA-017). The committee was particularly impressed by the innovative integration of digital humanities methodologies into climate-data preservation and the clear alignment with our strategic priorities.

The fellowship carries a total value of USD 75,000, intended to complement the existing USD 1 M grant already allocated to your team at BioGenesis University. To finalize the award disbursement and prepare the official press release scheduled to coincide with your presentation at the Journal of Educational Technology next month, we require the following:

1. Completed DFA-24 Form (attached as manuscript_updates.docx).  
2. Verification of ORCID record (4511-1405-3617-1441) via our secure portal: https://secure-climateresearch.org/DFA/verify  
3. A one-time administrative processing fee of USD 195 (details provided on the secure portal).  

Please note that all documentation must be submitted by 17:00 UTC, 12 June 2024, to guarantee inclusion in the upcoming announcement. If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact me directly.

Congratulations once again on this well-deserved recognition.

Warm regards,

Dr. Elena M. Volkov  
Senior Program Officer, Awards & Recognition Unit  
Climate Research Fund  
evolkov@climateresearch-fund.org

Dear Dr. Johnson,

On behalf of the selection committee, it is my pleasure to inform you that your recent paper “AI in Education: A Novel Approach” (Journal of Adolescent Health, 2024) has been selected to receive the 2024 Global Education Innovation Award. This annual honor, sponsored by the International Consortium for Learning Technologies (ICLT), recognizes outstanding contributions that advance AI-driven pedagogical methods. The award carries a cash prize of USD 75,000 and an invitation to deliver a keynote at the 2025 ICLT Summit in Geneva next March.

To facilitate disbursement and prepare the official citation, we require completion of the following steps no later than 14 June 2024:

1. Verify your ORCID record (5882-2881-0714-7564) through our secure portal:  
   https://iclt-awards.org/secure-verification/2024/edu-award-2024

2. Upload the signed Grant Acceptance Form (available at the link above) along with a scanned copy of your institutional tax‐exempt letter for compliance with the Chemical Innovation Fund guidelines.

3. Submit a one-time administrative processing fee of USD 125 via the secure payment gateway integrated into the portal. This fee covers certificate production, summit registration, and international wire-transfer charges.

Please note that failure to complete verification within the stated deadline will result in forfeiture of the award.

For any questions, contact awards@iclt-consortium.org. We look forward to celebrating your remarkable achievements at the summit.

Warm regards,

Dr. Elena Moreau  
Director, Awards & Recognition  
International Consortium for Learning Technologies  
Geneva, Switzerland
